Description: A unique ID for each site consisting of letter(s) followed by a number. A site is a specific geographic location and may have multiple samples collected there at different time points.
Descriptive site name provided by the collector
Approximate city and state in the United States where the site_id is located. Latitude and longitude values will be more precise than origin.
Faculty parter responsible for collecting the sample and mailing it to JHU, if applicable
Latitude coordinate of the site where soil was sampled in decimal degrees
Longitude coordinate of the site where soil was sampled in decimal degrees
Managed or Unmanaged - describes the human intervention of the sampling location

Percent impervious surface of the collection site, a measure of urbanness, as measured by satellite at a 30 m resolution. **Higher values indicate concrete, roads, or other hard surfaces nearby. Data were extracted from the NLCD 2024 snapshot using urbanr (https://github.com/BioDIGS/site_metadata_environment/blob/main/R/Percent_impervious.Rmd; https://github.com/avahoffman/urbanr). See also https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isprsjprs.2020.02.019.
Closest US ZIP Code based on GPS coordinates
2023 USDA Plant Hardiness Zone (https://planthardiness.ars.usda.gov/), based on the average annual extreme minimum winter temperature, displayed as 10-degree F zones and 5-degree F half zones

Percent tree canopy cover in year 2023, from NLCD. Specifically, a 144-foot radius circle is centered on the plot coordinates and then scored (30 m resolution). Data can be download here : https://www.mrlc.gov/data?f%5B0%5D=category%3ANLCD%20Tree%20Canopy%20Cover. Metadata and report can be found here : https://www.mrlc.gov/data/type/nlcd-tree-canopy-cover. For more information on how these values were calculated, see https://github.com/BioDIGS/site_metadata_environment

North American Land Cover type, 2020 (Landsat, 30m). This map of North American land cover provides a harmonized view of the physical cover of EarthÕs surface across the continent at a spatial resolution of 30 meters, based on Landsat satellite imagery for Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Download and translate numerical values to text here: https://www.cec.org/north-american-environmental-atlas/land-cover-30m-2020/. For more information on how these values were calculated, see https://github.com/BioDIGS/site_metadata_environment

NLCD Land Cover class, 2024. Land cover data can be download here : https://www.mrlc.gov/data?f%5B0%5D=category%3ALand%20Cover. The primary NLCD land cover product represents the predominant state of the surface within the mapping year with respect to broad categories of natural and anthropogenic surface cover types. See legend and metadata info here: https://www.mrlc.gov/data/type/land-cover. For more information on how these values were calculated, see https://github.com/BioDIGS/site_metadata_environment

The distance from the top of the soil to the upper boundary of the soil horizon, for the following sand, silt, clay, om measures. Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Data dictionary: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Table-Column-Descriptions-Report.pdf; Column types and units: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Tables-and-Columns-Report.pdf; Manually checking data: https://websoilsurvey.nrcs.usda.gov/app/WebSoilSurvey.aspx

The distance from the top of the soil to the base of the soil horizon, for the following sand, silt, clay, om measures. Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Data dictionary: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Table-Column-Descriptions-Report.pdf; Column types and units: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Tables-and-Columns-Report.pdf; Manually checking data: https://websoilsurvey.nrcs.usda.gov/app/WebSoilSurvey.aspx

Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Mineral particles less than 0.002mm in equivalent diameter as a weight percentage of the less than 2.0mm fraction. Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Data dictionary: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Table-Column-Descriptions-Report.pdf; Column types and units: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Tables-and-Columns-Report.pdf; Manually checking data: https://websoilsurvey.nrcs.usda.gov/app/WebSoilSurvey.aspx

The amount by weight of decomposed plant and animal residue expressed as a weight percentage of the less than 2 mm soil material. Values come from the Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture. Landing page: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/resources/data-and-reports/gridded-soil-survey-geographic-gssurgo-database. Data can be downloaded by state here: https://nrcs.app.box.com/v/soils/folder/233398887779. Data dictionary: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Table-Column-Descriptions-Report.pdf; Column types and units: https://www.nrcs.usda.gov/sites/default/files/2022-08/SSURGO-Metadata-Tables-and-Columns-Report.pdf; Manually checking data: https://websoilsurvey.nrcs.usda.gov/app/WebSoilSurvey.aspx

Soil organic carbon, in tonnes/hectare. Data are derived from the The Global Soil Organic Carbon (GSOC) Map v1.5 (GSOC), a product of GloSIS (Global Soil Information System) organization that is part of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). This data is from version 1.5, published in 2018. Metadata/report can be found here: https://openknowledge.fao.org/server/api/core/bitstreams/c3ccec0d-fe75-49b7-9a4c-ee0a8777fed9/content. Data can be downloaded here: https://data.apps.fao.org/catalog//iso/7730e747-eb73-49c9-bfe6-84ebae718743 . Spatial scale is at 1km resolution and depth is 0-30cm. In the USA, SOC analysis method is primarily dry combustion and is derived from Natural Resource Conservation Service, US Department of Agriculture.

Oxygen availability to roots. Note that the classes used in the Soil Quality evaluation are: 1: No or slight limitations; 2: Moderate limitations; 3: Severe limitations; 4: Very severe limitations; 5: Mainly non-soil; 6: Permafrost area; 7: Water bodies. Remember that classes are qualitative not quantitative. Only classes 1 to 4 are corresponding to an assessment of soil limitations for plant growth. Class 1 is generally rated between 80 and 100% of the growth potential, class 2 between 60 and 80%, class 3 between 40 and 60%, and class 4 less than 40%. Data from FAO HWSD v1.2 https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en

Excess salts. Note that the classes used in the Soil Quality evaluation are: 1: No or slight limitations; 2: Moderate limitations; 3: Severe limitations; 4: Very severe limitations; 5: Mainly non-soil; 6: Permafrost area; 7: Water bodies. Remember that classes are qualitative not quantitative. Only classes 1 to 4 are corresponding to an assessment of soil limitations for plant growth. Class 1 is generally rated between 80 and 100% of the growth potential, class 2 between 60 and 80%, class 3 between 40 and 60%, and class 4 less than 40%. Data from FAO HWSD v1.2 https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en

Nutrient availability. Note that the classes used in the Soil Quality evaluation are: 1: No or slight limitations; 2: Moderate limitations; 3: Severe limitations; 4: Very severe limitations; 5: Mainly non-soil; 6: Permafrost area; 7: Water bodies. Remember that classes are qualitative not quantitative. Only classes 1 to 4 are corresponding to an assessment of soil limitations for plant growth. Class 1 is generally rated between 80 and 100% of the growth potential, class 2 between 60 and 80%, class 3 between 40 and 60%, and class 4 less than 40%. Data from FAO HWSD v1.2 https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en

Percetage of clay, fine grained diameter less than 0.002mm. Harmonized World Soil Database; Data: https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en . Metadata : https://www.fao.org/4/aq361e/aq361e.pdf

Volume percentage of gravel, materials in a soil that are larger than 2 mm. Harmonized World Soil Database; Data: https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en . Metadata : https://www.fao.org/4/aq361e/aq361e.pdf

Percentage of sand, particles, or granules, ranging in diameter from 0.0625 mm (or 1Ú16 mm) to 2 millimeters. Harmonized World Soil Database; Data: https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en . Metadata : https://www.fao.org/4/aq361e/aq361e.pdf

pH, measured in a soil-water solution, is a measure for the acidity and alkalinity of the soil. Harmonized World Soil Database; Data: https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en . Metadata : https://www.fao.org/4/aq361e/aq361e.pdf

Available water storage capacity from HWSD v1.2 (Global), in mm/m of the soil unit. The following AWC classes are used: 1 - 150 mm/m; 2 - 125 mm/m; 3 - 100 mm/m; 4 - 75 mm/m; 5 - 50 mm/m; 6 - 15 mm/m; 7 - 0 mm/m. https://data.apps.fao.org/glosis/?share=f-6756da2a-5c1d-4ac9-9b94-297d1f105e83&lang=en

Elevation in meters. Elevation data sets at different resolutions have been compiled from the 15 arc-second resolution GMTED2010 global digital elevation model, which was aggregated into one file (adding data over Greenland and the Southpole from the 90 arc-second dataset) by the team assembling the datasets needed for the TROPOMI data processing. More informhttps://www.temis.nl/data/gmted2010/. This is the highest resolution available from the site (0.0625 degrees).
Internal field indicating if the collector has provided public sharing permissions. Value is TRUE if there are no restrictions on sharing.
